segments.pli: “Jānatohaṃ, bhikkhave, passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato apassato.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I say that the ending of defilements is for one who knows and sees, not for one who does not know or see.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, jānato passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti?
segments.en: For one who knows and sees what?

segments.pli: ‘Idaṃ dukkhan’ti, bhikkhave, jānato passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti jānato passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti jānato passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti jānato passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti.
segments.en: The ending of defilements is for one who knows and sees suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, jānato evaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayo hoti.
segments.en: The ending of the defilements is for one who knows and sees this.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, I say that the ending of defilements is…

suttaplex.blurb: Only by knowing and seeing the four noble truths are the defilements ended.
